result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

22CF170 and 22CF243 to be set for a PreTrial Conference on 10/10/22 @ 9:30 a.m.
State is in compliance with victim right notification.

3:18 PM Defendant Nicholas E Halsey in court.  Attorney Russ S. Kort in court for Nicholas E Halsey.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Kort had efiled a hard copy of the waiver of preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing and Order to Bind Over filed by Atty Russ Kort

Adjustment Number: 22A 059584,
Payable Number: 62512,
Receipt Number: 22R 007912,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas E Halsey in court.  Attorney (Atty) Kort is present.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:05 PM Defendant Nicholas E Halsey appeared by video, in custody.   Atty Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears on behalf of  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA  Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Stalking - Domestic Abuse, Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order/Injunction - Domestic Abuse and 2 Counts of Felony Bail Jumping.
Defendant is not public defender eligible.
Atty Russ Kort represents the defendant on his other cases.
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $15,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Atty Bergner objects to the requested cash bond and would ask for a lower cash bond of $2,000 and states his reasons on the record for the lower cash bond.
Court would set a $10,000 cash bond and states the reasons on the record.
Initial Appearance set for July 11, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 3
